Re ''Beyond the Organizer: Handhelds Add Power and Peripherals,'' State of the Art, April 27): The combination of Psion hardware and EPOC software does everything that Palm and the Pocket PC claim to do, and even what they say they will do in the future. That means full Microsoft Office file compatability, wireless e-mail and Web access, etc.

The difference is that Psion and EPOC actually do it. They have done it since late 1999 with actual devices that are out there, not vaporware. And they have a majority market share in the European Union, which has a larger population than the United States. Its cumulative real-user United States market share is comparable to CE's. And with its Symbian alliance (and now Sony) its hype-able future is as bright as anybody's.
